page.title: 07Wivelsfield - Education (2)
page.content:
A{Playgroup}was started in the early 1970's for children between the ages of 2\ and school age. It is held in Wivelsfield Village Hall 3 mornings a week and is able to cater for around 20 children.
The children are supervised by trained staff and 'mother-helpers'. The children develop language, confidence and independence which stands them in good stead for starting school.
They also learn to mix with others and are able to paint, listen to stories and join in with group activities as well as playing with a variety of toys, sand, water, dough etc.
The playgroup relies on fees and fund-raising to meet its costs as it receives no aid form the authorities.
